TI_DOC.P: EBGU - GRCF — ENERGIEFFEKTIV RENOVERING AF HOSPITALET I ZENICA (BA-Zenica)

CONTENTS.P: Project name: GrCF -Energy Efficient Refurbishment of Zenica Hospital
Country: Bosnia and Herzegovina
Business sector: Municipal and Environmental Infrastructure
Project ID: 48171
Procurement ID: 8987-GPN-48171
Funding source: EBRD, EBRD SSF Grant and Regional Energy Efficiency Programme (“REEP”) Grant
Type of contract: Works, goods and services
Type of notice: General procurement notice
Issue date: 16.2.2018
Closing date: 16.2.2019

Bosnia and Herzegovina (“BiH”) intends using the proceeds of a loan from the European bank for reconstruction and development [the Bank] for a project to energy efficient refurbishment of the Zenica Cantonal Hospital. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of 11 600 000 EUR equivalent, will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services:
— Construction and mechanical works,
— Infrastructure works for connection to the natural gas network,
— Supervision of construction and mechanical works,
— Supervision of infrastructure works for connection to the natural gas network,
— Credit enhancement programme,
— Development of the GCAP for the City of Zenica.
Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in the second quarter of 2018.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's procurement policies and rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

TI_DOC.P: EBWE - GrCF -ENERGIEEFFIZIENTE SANIERUNG DES KRANKENHAUSES IN ZENICA (BA-Zenica)

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's procurement policies and rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.
